@KyleGarnerMO Says Joshua when the vast majority of Missourians were completely unaware that our far right legislature banned all abortions, even in the cases of rape and incest.

There’s a reason this wasn’t left to voters. A ban like that never would have passed.

Christian fascism is real. It is here.

It now dictates what healthcare is available to women. It has gutted the establishment clause, paving the way for very little separation between church and state. Marriage is next.

There’s a reason they oppose the ERA & Equality Act y’all.

Now that the Missouri government is mandating forced pregnancy, I’m sure any day now there will be a special legislative session that provides 24 weeks of paid parental leave, universal childcare, universal healthcare, fully funded schools, and pediatric clinics in every county.

Y’all what filter do I have to turn on to find all of the people supporting forced pregnancy talk about their plan to force men into fatherhood and their responsibilities as a parent?

No luck so far…

And when you do, we will secure a pro-democracy future with equal rights, bodily autonomy, healthcare access, living wages, fully funded schools, and community investments.

That’s the path.

And that’s how powerful you are.

Which is why they’re fighting like hell to stop you.

It will not be easy. It won’t be comfortable. It may not come naturally to you. But you can do this. You can have conversations. You can show up and get involved. You can bring out the best in others. You can bring along one more. And you can probably do much more than that.

The future is ours for the taking. It is ours if we want it. If we can be bold enough and brave enough to step into our own power and use our voice, organize and build community. 

Do you feel it yet? The power you have to make change?

And they only have so much time left to try. And that makes them dangerous. They will do anything they can to keep us from using our power because they know that when we do—when we sit in and harness the power that is rightfully ours—they will be held accountable for their harm.

The entire goal is to undo progress at all costs because progress leaves these people with less control and power.

They’re cornered. They have been for years. These people are not capable of winning an election so they plan to steal it. Literally. You watched it happen.

But in my first Presidential election, President Obama lost by less than 4,000 votes. 

Yup. I know. Red ass Missouri. Racism is a religion Missouri. 4,000 votes.

Then we got Citizens United, dark money and unlimited donations. And the Tea Party and the whiplash was violent.

Anything they could do to hold onto one last bit of power.

Same thing with President Obama. We were a slave state. Had segregation in some places until the 1990s and honestly some of the suburban areas are de facto segregated still due to redlining. Racism runs deep here.

But in college, other states said hell no and pushed back. In law school, same sex marriage became the law of the land. 

And the fascists in Missouri went irate. Didn’t wanna hand out marriage licenses anymore. Tried to say businesses don’t have to bake cakes. Just nonsense.

They have a limited window left to strike. These radical actions in the last few years are the death throes of Christian fascism. 

When I was in high school, I watched these people try to limit marriage to a man and woman. In Missouri, they succeeded.

Strengthen our democracy for 2024 and beyond.

And let me tell you this: I talk a lot about we are in the eye of the storm. That we must act to survive. And it’s true—but it is just as dire for the fascists. 

They know that if held to account for their crimes, it’s over.

How many people who didn’t or couldn’t vote in 2020 could you get to show up this November? 

Because if each of us bring along just 1 new person—that’s game over folks. 

That’s a decisive House and Senate victory. We can codify Roe. Strengthen voting rights. Admit new states.

Together, we can light the way forward. 

I want you to imagine using the full weight of your power between now and November. The full power of your voice, of your ability to organize and build community.

Close your eyes and really think about what that could look like for you.

But we need you to start seeing your power too. 

We need you to own that power.

We need you to harness that power and to see it for all of the value it has. To let that brilliant flame inside of you shine so that others may see it and feel brave enough to shine too.

And you may feel like that right now. Or you may feel rage or sadness or an erratic flow between all 3 throughout the day. However you are processing the trauma of having your rights taken from you is okay. You are allowed the space you need to do the processing you need to do.

There are about to be many, many moments and opportunities for you to use your powers of voice, organizing, and community in the coming weeks, months and years. The greatest tool the other side has is to make you believe you aren’t powerful at all—to make you despair in silence.

Y’all have another power too. You have the power to lift others up. The power to support the men and women and children around you. To help them find these powers within themselves. To help them harness and sit in and thrive in their own power. Help them turn that light on y’all.

Take the life skills you have already developed and expand into a new area—you may be concerned. It may feel uncomfortable. That’s okay! It is uncomfortable at first. But you can do this. You’ve been doing it for other reasons. Now do it to secure your future.

You have attended a gathering or supported an event with other folks for some purpose. You already know how to show up, how to participate, how to plan.

Now you’re going to unlock new levels within that power. Invite folks over to meet a candidate. Sign up to phone bank.

Your power is your ability to organize. 

If you’ve ever taught in a classroom, participated in a union, served in the military, held a garage sale, joined a Bible study, worked a bake sale, welcomed trick-or-treaters, or planned a birthday party you, my friend, have organized.

If you don’t already, deliberately harness that power. I’m talking look yourself in the mirror and decide that today you will use your voice in the spaces you are most valued to advocate for what you need. Get them to join you in the work that must be done.

Your power is your voice. There are people in this world who love you. Who would walk through fire for you. You can reach them in ways no celebrity or amount of money or level of propaganda ever could. Reach out to those people. It may be 1 or 2 or 3 people.

You are powerful beyond measure. 

In fact, you are so powerful, there are people who seek to silence you, who seek to keep you from voting, who seek to burden you with stress + debt + insecurities so you focus your power on survival instead of them.

As dark as things are—and they are dark—I want people to know that there is a path forward. 

And we can do it.

If this hasn’t happened to you yet, it’s about to. That moment when you realize you—yes you there, doomscrolling—you are capable of more than you know. 

🧵

And, I want to add that we can fight back. The trigger law is in statute--not the Constitution. We can use the initiative petition process to add an amendment to Missouri's Constitution that would codify Roe.

And then, if you're a Missourian, I need you to help us end the supermajority in Jefferson City. I need you to help us build a pro-democracy community in every county in this state so we can take our rights back.

Sign up to volunteer on a campaign below.

This should include legislation that:

▪️ guarantees access to birth control + IVF
▪️ protects right to travel for abortion
▪️ prohibits criminalizing abortion
▪️ prohibits investigating miscarriages
▪️ prohibits searching our mail
▪️ allows abortion in the case of rape or incest

These pieces of legislation + actions are extreme. But they aren't going anywhere. So you need to know that they exist. That they've tried to pass them before and they're going to continue trying.

We need state and federal legislators to draft bills that will defend our rights.

On the federal level, Mitch McConnell has said that he  supports a national ban on abortion, so that the horrors in Missouri and other red states can become a reality elsewhere.
https://t.co/5nB4iiZPwi

And I know folks are concerned about the government tracking women's periods via data and certain apps. But, in Missouri they did it old school. With an excel spreadsheet. 

Nope. Not kidding.
https://t.co/MQ9a88O5SU
In Missouri, they also tried to give "unborn children" "equal protection of the laws." https://t.co/RijmaylJ3e

How do they define "unborn resident"--if the mother is a resident of the state during the abortion or conception, or if the sex occurred within state lines. 

Yeah. I'm not joking. You have sex in Missouri, these people tried to declare any resulting embryo an unborn resident. https://t.co/PwBvngussO

There are different ways they want to accomplish this, such as:
- banning partial treatment out of state
-ban out-of-state abortions if payment, consent, or advertisement occurs in Missouri
-ban out-of-state abortions by creating the classification of an "unborn resident" https://t.co/Vmc1AYWhh0

And cropping up in a red state near you are attempts to prevent residents from obtaining abortions out of state. This has not passed in Missouri. Crossing state lines for an abortion remains legal, for now. https://t.co/Rg7Mzl6d6H

But understanding how the human body works is not a requirement for Republican Autocrats. Just a few months ago a bill was voted out of committee that made it a class A felony to perform an abortion on a woman with an ectopic pregnancy. This bill did not ultimately pass. https://t.co/lNNAx1EeZt

The amendment passed 21-12 in the Senate, but did not make it into the final passed bill. 

But it's a sign as to how far MO Republican Autocrats are willing to go. MO State Senator Denny Hoskins openly opposes seems to oppose birth control despite not understanding how it works. https://t.co/79Cr9amUIb

Just last year, over a debate on Medicaid funding, an amendment was introduced that would prevent tax dollars from paying for "any drug or device . . . that may cause the destruction of, or prevent the implantation of, an unborn child . . ." https://t.co/WgkDIj7Vd5

In Missouri, any physician providing abortions to patients is guilty of a class B felony, with the exception of saving the life of the mother.

Meaning that a rapist could face a lighter sentence than the doctor providing healthcare to the survivor. https://t.co/w5qluceNbA

HB 126 defines "conception" as "the fertilization of the ovum of a female by the sperm of a male."

And further defines "unborn child" as existing "from the moment of conception until birth at and every stage of its biological development . . . " https://t.co/SQTTlqDxtd

Today, Governor Parson issued a proclamation that put HB 126 into full effect. 

Abortion is now banned in Missouri from the point of fertilization onward. There are no exceptions for rape or incest. https://t.co/Wr09h7YV3c

The states are laboratories of democracy. 

In Missouri the experiment has gone badly wrong. Three years ago, Republican Autocrats passed HB 126--our abortion ban trigger law. 

It was a matter of time before it went nationwide.

Here's what's coming next.

@LuluForTexas @KatyTurNBC They're trying to do that here in Missouri, too. But as of today, although abortion is now illegal, the travel for abortion care is not. 

And I don't want people in search of care to think that at this moment it is.

Seriously, y'all. Some of you must be new here. 

I know that red states are going to try and make crossing state lines illegal. 

But it is not illegal today. Suggesting that it is already illegal is not helpful to people searching for help today.

https://t.co/pZNOCPWDio

@dwb2290 @KatyTurNBC Aboslutely.

But suggesting anyone who leaves in search of access is a criminal is dangerous. Red states are already trying to make this happen and we need to make it clear that travel for healthcare is not illegal.

Rather, I want to encourage journalists to make it clear that one is not a criminal for traveling to states that are willing to provide abortion care to people who need it. 

And for those of you like "yeah, well just wait" I hear you. You're right. They're gonna try.

Is this a great solution? Of course not. Low income women especially likely do not have the means to travel to receive an abortion. 

My tweet is not meant to suggest "Oh it's fine you can travel." 

And I don't want people to take it as such.

And because not everyone was watching that segment--Tur seemed to think the Attorney General of California was asking people to break the law by offering California as a sanctuary state to those seeking abortion access. 

No one is breaking the law by visiting California.

Someone let @KatyTurNBC know that the Dobbs holding says each state decides the legality of abortion within its own boundaries. 

Citizens remain free to move about the country to states that recognize we have a right to bodily autonomy.

Travel is not illegal.

He hoped the coup would work.

But Senator Lee was concerned that without those competing slates of electors, “people like Ted and Josh” would benefit with their attempts to object to Pennsylvania’s results to the “detriment of DJT.” https://t.co/3iMQK39uMS

The next day, Senator Mike Lee was concerned about how Ted Cruz and Joshua Hawley were going about the effort to overturn the election.

Three days later, Joshua had secured 11 other US Senators to “vote against” President Biden’s victory.

Notably, Joshua referred to this as a “fight” and told everyone it was “Time to STAND UP” https://t.co/lirO3WpTcI

By the end of December 2020, Joshua Hawley made a decision. 

He would be the first Senator to publicly announce he would object to the certification of Pennsylvania’s election results. https://t.co/xU1SSRJ27h

On the very day the first suit failed, Joshua’s replacement in the Missouri AG’s office, Eric Schmitt, had Missouri sign onto another suit.

This one was brought by Texas against Pennsylvania, Georgia, Michigan and Wisconsin.

Three days later the Supreme Court rejected it. https://t.co/6R30Rkgugq

Filing an amicus brief in support of this suit? None other than Missouri’s very own Schlafly Eagle Forum. 

A group that named Joshua it’s “Republican of the Year” in 2019. He’s since spoke at their summits along with fellow seditionist Ted Cruz. https://t.co/crK8NWzOBS

But he wholly supported the lawsuit Rep. Kelly filed against Pennsylvania. 

If successful, the suit would have prevented Pennsylvania from certifying its election results.

The Supreme Court denied the request. https://t.co/1RXdWxb4ZY

One of the first Senators to publicly discuss this was Joshua Hawley.

Had he any concern about Pennsylvania’s law during early voting in October?

Nope.

Had he any concern about Pennsylvania’s law before Trump lost the election?

Nope. https://t.co/S9pYT1egos

Rather than just sending alternative slates of electors, some attorneys sought to overturn the election by insisting that Pennsylvania’s results should be tossed because the state itself failed to follow its own laws.

We know that in the face of tremendous pressure that individuals in Arizona, Georgia, Pennsylvania and other states refused to go along with this scheme.

And when that pushback occurred, it looks like a second path to overturning the election opened.

The Committee Hearings on January 6th have honed in on the legal plan to overturn the election.

Trump and his attorneys plotted to work with Republican state officials encouraging them to either find more votes or to send alternative slates of electors.

It’s time to revisit Joshua Hawley’s role in January 6th. 

A necessary recap.

RT @piper4missouri: I’d love to meet y’all and I’m bringing pie! 🥧☕️ https://t.co/P0hKJ7bHPs

Nope. Don’t wanna hear about the sanctity of 9 justices on the Supreme Court.

It went down to 8 a few years ago in total circumvention of every norm and it was done by one man that citizens in 49 states never had the opportunity to elect.

So nope. Not having it today.

I don’t care where in the state you are—I’ve spoken with candidates and clubs in every part of Missouri this year. Tell me what you need. I may not be able to provide it but I bet I can put you in touch with someone who can.

We change our future from the ground up. 

Together.

In case I have not made this abundantly clear—if you are a candidate or a county club or some other organization, I will personally help you however I can.

This year alone I have written campaign plans, finance plans, planned fundraisers, events and canvasses. 

I will help you.

People are dying. They are dying and they are scared and they donate what little they can spare and they sacrifice time with their family to show up in places the folks making decisions about who’s worthy of attention wouldn’t deign to appear.

In my view, our state has a leadership problem. We got people spending more time on cable news than in our communities. 

Politicians more interested in punditry than public service.

Consultants who wanna cash in but don’t wanna canvass.

You fools cannot win statewide races in Missouri by only winning St. Louis and Kansas City. 

And you aren’t gonna get volunteers + voters to do the work in other places by waiting to show up *after* a primary. 

You should have started building community everywhere years ago.

Yes.
